positive: To be honest, if Arrow Lake is similarly efficient as Lunar Lake but more powerful (and thus there are laptops that are truly silent during normal use), I will definitely sell the laptop and get one with Arrow Lake.
So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.

* The keyboard is incredible (one of the things I liked about the new model when I tried it at Best Buy) * The glass trackpad also feels amazing and has a fairly satisfying click (I prefer this to haptic personally).
negative: All IPS panels have IPS glow, but this one has the worst case of glow I've ever seen.
Originally, I wrote a long post, but I didn't save it and it got lost.
The keys feel a little shallower than on the HP 14c, but once I got into a groove, I had no complaints.

positive: So yes, very good slim light laptop overall, 15.3" screen size is perfect too, though I hope these spinning wheel, fan noise, trackpad issues are all software related and get a quick fix from Lenovo.

Lenovo Pro 9i Yoga or Copilot+PC laptop Hi, I want to purchase 15 16-inch mobile laptop for heavy Imaging data analysis so excellent screen is a must), lots of Excel, Fiji imageJ (image analysis) and Graphpad files which would be easy to navigate between as well.

But that’s OK, because I still got a solid 9–10.5 hours under heavy, real-world use: * 20–30 tabs open * Zoom app + Teams (web) * YouTube music streaming * Constant typing * Screen at ~70% Compared to my aging HP, which lasts about 4–5 hours now, this is a major win.

negative: The Lenovo is fast, but the jitters and lag it has when doing real-world stuff are unacceptable for me at that price.
